content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the lowest fare from all eligible one-way flights for 1 adult from JFK to Heathrow on May 22, 2026.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/travel/flights/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To start searching for a flight from JFK to Heathrow, I need to enter the origin and destination. The input box labeled "Where from?" (13) is set to Toronto, so I need to change it to JFK.
Action: Type 13; JFK
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure airport (JFK) is now set. Next, I need to enter the destination airport, which is Heathrow. The "Where to?" textbox (14) is empty and should be filled.
Action: Type 14; Heathrow
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The origin (JFK) and destination (Heathrow/London LHR) are now set. Next, I need to select the departure date (May 22, 2026) by interacting with the "Departure" date input (16).
Action: Click 16
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently displays September and October, but the requested date is May 22, 2026. I need to click "Next" (74) multiple times to move forward to May 2026.
Action: Click 74
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently displaying October and November. Since the target date is May 2026, I need to keep clicking "Next" (75) until I reach May 2026.
Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.48
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently showing November and December, but I need to reach May 2026. I should continue clicking the "Next" button (75) to progress to the desired month.
Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar view has advanced to January 2026, but I need to reach May 2026. I should continue using the "Next" button (76) to keep moving forward to May 2026.
Action: Click 76
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.53
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows January and February 2026. Since May 2026 is still a few months ahead, I need to keep clicking the "Next" button (73) to advance to May 2026.
Action: Click 73
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.56
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows February and March 2026. May 2026 is still ahead, so I need to continue advancing by clicking the "Next" button (73).
Action: Click 73
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.59
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing March and April 2026. May 2026 is still ahead, so I need to continue to the next months by clicking the "Next" button (75).
Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.62
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays May 2026. The fare for May 22, 2026, is visible and listed as $779. To confirm the date selection and proceed to view the eligible flights, I should click the "Done" button (78).
Action: Click 78
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure and destination fields are correctly filled, and the date was previously set. To view the available one-way flights and fares for the chosen date, I need to click the "Search" button (18).
Action: Click 18
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar interface has appeared again, showing different months (September and October) with a range of fares. This suggests the date selection was not finalized or needs adjustment. I need to advance to May 2026 to reselect May 22. I should use the "Next" button (74) to navigate to May 2026.
Action: Click 74
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows October and November, but I need to reach May 2026. I should continue clicking the "Next" button (75) to advance the calendar further to the required departure month.
Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.83
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar view has reached November and December, but May 2026 is still not visible. I need to keep clicking the "Next" button (75) to proceed further in the calendar toward May 2026.
Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing December and January 2026. May 2026 is still a few months ahead, so I need to continue advancing the calendar by clicking the "Next" button (76).
Action: Click 76
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows January and February 2026, but I need to reach May 2026. I should keep clicking the "Next" button (73) to move further ahead to the required departure month.
Action: Click 73
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.89

Thought: The calendar is showing February and March 2026, but May 2026 is still two months away. I need to keep clicking the "Next" button (73) to advance to May 2026.
Action: Click 73
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.91

Thought: The calendar is now showing March and April 2026. To reach May 2026, I need to continue clicking the "Next" button (75) to advance the view to May.
Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.93

Thought: The calendar now displays May 2026, and May 22 is visible with a fare of $779. I should confirm this date selection by clicking the "Done" button (78) to proceed and view the eligible flight results for this departure date.
Action: Click 78
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.97
